definition: to turn one's head/in no time/in the twinkling of an eye
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)

sentences.english: Jane put one foot in the near stirrup and turned to look at the stranger.
sentences.chinese: 简一只脚就近蹬上马镫，转脸看着陌生人。

sentences.english: Then he turned his face to the wall, and prayed unto the LORD, saying.
sentences.chinese: 希西家就转脸朝墙，祷告耶和华说。

sentences.english: Then set my face to the town;
Harry looked back at the water.
sentences.chinese: 哈利转脸又看了看湖水。

sentences.english: The reporters turned to him and started peppering him with questions.
sentences.chinese: 记者们转脸望向他，连珠炮似地向他发问。

sentences.english: When they show an operation on TV, I have to turn away.
sentences.chinese: 电视上播手术过程时，我只能转脸不看。

definition: to turn one's head/to turn around
to turn one's head/to change direction/U-turn/volte face/to repent
nutation (plants turning to face the sun)
to pout/to stick out one's lips
like a smile yet not a smile (idiom)
to take a furtive look at
to shoot a glance/glance/to appear in a flash
to have a smile on one's face
